title: Why are students still reading 'Brave New World'? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s fairly easy to read, so it’s good for a class with mixed reading comprehension. The story is pretty simple, too. It’s science fiction, which young people like, or that’s what most teachers think: one step up from fairy tales, with adults doing adult kinds of things. Depending on the school district, you can choose to talk about how people are amusing themselves into triviality (liberal) or point out that a society that takes drugs for fun and has sex outside of marriage is bad, ‘mkay? It gives kids the feeling that they’re a lot smarter than they are if they can point out similarities with the Bad Place that is After Ford. And that’s that!

If students are reading, it must be because their teacher wanted it. They would rather do something more pleasurable. As the late Professor David Luke (famous translator of German classics) once said of his students at Oxford, they rather fornicate than to read High German grammar.
